Title(s): ‘The Wooing of the King quhen he wes in Dumfermeling’
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The Wooing of the King quhen he wes in Dumfermeling’ (The Tod and the Lamb) — ten seven-line stanzas

CULLl510.First Lines:
This hindir nycht in dumfermelingTo me was tauld ane wonderous
                    thing…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…And ay þe lame cryit Ladie helpAnd þat me thocht a
                    feirlie cace

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
This hyndir nycht in dumfermlingTo me wes tauld ane wondrous
                    thing…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…And þis Repoirt I with my penHow at Dumfermling fell the
                    cace
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.407-9.

Banna.First Lines:
This hindir nycht in dumfermelingTo me wes tawld ane windir
                    thing…
Banna.Last Lines:
…And this report I with my penHow at Dumfermling
                        thair fell the cace
Banna.Note:
Follows þe wowing of the king quhen he wes in dumfermeling (f.
                    116).
